result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Dillon Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Dillon Castillo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan

ADDRESS INFO for Mark Dillon Castillo
Current: PO Box 484, Colfax, WI 54730 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2016)
Prior: 909 University Ave, Colfax, WI 54730
Summons for FTP Hearing mailed to Defendant has been returned.  Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.  Re-mailed on April 1, 2016, to new address per Defendant.
JOC has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.

9:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has received an offer and will accept.  DA recites agreement, will amend to misdemeanor possession of THC with a fine and costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$350 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:19 a.m.

10:20 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests to talk with the DA.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.

Defendant called and requested his court date be changed to the other court date that was given in court as that would work better for him.  Rescheduled to 11/24/2015 at 10:00 a.m.

43
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 8, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:54 a.m.
